pixi.renderers.canvas.CanvasRenderer

type
class
metadata
:native
"PIXI.CanvasRenderer"

Constructor

new(width : Float, height : Float, ?options : pixi.utils.RenderingOptions)
parameters
[width=800] {Number} the width of the canvas view
[height=600] {Number} the height of the canvas view
[options] {Object} The optional renderer parameters
[options.view] {HTMLCanvasElement} the canvas to use as a view, optional
[options.transparent=false] {Bool} If the render view is transparent, default false
[options.resolution=1] {Number} the resolution of the renderer retina would be 2
[options.clearBeforeRender=true] {Bool} This sets if the CanvasRenderer will clear the canvas or not before the new render pass.
The CanvasRenderer draws the Stage and all its content onto a 2d canvas. This renderer should be used for browsers that do not support webGL. Don't forget to add the CanvasRenderer.view to your DOM or you will not see anything :)

Instance Variables

clearBeforeRender : Bool

This sets if the CanvasRenderer will clear the canvas or not before the new render pass. If the Stage is NOT transparent Pixi will use a canvas sized fillRect operation every frame to set the canvas background color. If the Stage is transparent Pixi will use clearRect to clear the canvas every frame. Disable this by setting this to false. For example if your game has a canvas filling background image you often don't need this set.

context : js.html.CanvasRenderingContext2D

The canvas 2d context that everything is drawn with

height : Float

The height of the canvas view

maskManager : pixi.renderers.canvas.utils.CanvasMaskManager

Instance of a PIXI.CanvasMaskManager, handles masking when using the canvas renderer

renderSession : Dynamic

The render session is just a bunch of parameter used for rendering

transparent : Bool

Whether the render view is transparent

view : js.html.CanvasElement

The canvas element that everything is drawn to

width : Float

The width of the canvas view

Instance Methods

destroy(?removeView : Bool) : Void

parameters
[removeView=true] {Bool} Removes the Canvas element from the DOM.
Removes everything from the renderer and optionally removes the Canvas DOM element.

render(stage : pixi.display.Stage) : Void

parameters
stage {Stage} the Stage element to be rendered
Renders the stage to its canvas view

resize(width : Float, height : Float) : Void

parameters
width {Number} the new width of the canvas view
height {Number} the new height of the canvas view
Resizes the canvas view to the specified width and height
